oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Battle of Talladega scene
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color engraving, "Battle of Talladega," shows mounted American troops pursuing Creek Indians. One fleeing Native American is carrying a musket. The Americans are charging with drawn swords. From John Frost and William Croome, "Pictorial Life of Andrew Jackson."
Major-General General Jackson fought a raiding party of Creek Indians in a fierce battle at Talladega in November 1813. Talladega is in present-day Alabama.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Generals;Soldiers;Campaigns & battles;Indians of North America;Forts & fortifications
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Devereaux
